content: By Dan Gainor Vice President Business & Media Institute +++http://foxforum.blogs.foxnews.com/2009/03/04/gainor_obama_media/ In the 2004 movie “Garden State,” Natalie Portman plays Sam, a character who just can’t stop lying. “I don’t even know why I do it. It’s like… it’s like a tick, I mean sometimes I hear myself say something and then I think, wow, that wasn’t even remotely true,” she explains to lucky soon-to-be-boyfriend Zach Braff. Five years later, Sam would be working for Obama. Why? Because she lies and since she’s cute and charismatic, no one cares. What a perfect spokeswoman for the Obama administration. They lie with reckless abandon. But Obama flashes his trademark smile and no one notices –- especially the media. You won’t hear about the lying on ABC, CBS or NBC. Or read it in The Washington Post or New York Times either. Last year, the news media threw considerable influence behind President Pinocchio. Now journalism is in such financial distress, they’d be hard-pressed to fact check his cereal box. Besides it’s a sin of Washington etiquette to call a deliberate political misstatements “lies.” Only the uncouth call them actual lies. We are one month in to a marathon game of liar’s poker and the American public is playing the losing hand. It’s not as if the Obama folks are stupid. They aren’t. They aren’t even compulsive or pathological. They are simply of a breed apart from ordinary humans — they’re politicians. And it’s funny because that was the one thing they claimed they weren’t. The one big “change” from previous Washington creatures. But it’s no change at all. They lie about Iraq. They lie about guns. They lie about the economy. They lie about the size of government. Then they lie about lying. Welcome to the Pinocchio administration : Obama is the only one pulling strings on the media. The rest of us in the audience watch fascinated. You won’t hear about the lying on ABC, CBS or NBC. Or read it in The Washington Post or New York Times either. Last year, the news media threw considerable influence behind President Pinocchio. Now journalism is in such financial distress, they’d be hard-pressed to fact check his cereal box. Besides it’s a sin of Washington etiquette to call a deliberate political misstatements “lies.” Only the uncouth call them actual lies. Remember the Barack Obama who proposed pulling our troops out of Iraq by the end of 2008? “The days of our open-ended commitment must come to a close,” he told the Senate, according to a Jan. 31, 2007, Washington Post article. Now, according to the Associated Press, the open-ended commitment has been replaced with “as many as 50,000 troops to remain behind to train Iraqi forces and protect U.S. interests.” Even anti-war lefties think he lied. They are right –- for once. Remember that guy Obama who supported gun rights? He’s just a faint memory. A year ago, in an interview with Politico, Obama was reminded that supported gun ownership: “You said recently, ‘I have no intention of taking away folks’ guns.’ But you support the D.C. handgun ban, and you’ve said that it’s constitutional. How do you reconcile those two positions?” Even then he hemmed and hawed, concluding: “We can have a reasonable, thoughtful gun control measure that I think respects the Second Amendment and people’s traditions.” “Reasonable, thoughtful” are words unknown to Attorney General Eric Holder. Holder already has tried to link the Mexican narco-wars to U.S. gun sales and go after supposed “assault weapons.” Obama’s record on government and the economy is actually worse. He and his surrogates keep maintaining that his budget won’t hurt the pockets of 95 percent of Americans who will get a tax cut. They lie. The lead editorial in the Feb. 27 Wall Street Journal showed by just how much. Using 2006 tax records, The Wall Street Journal showed how a tax hike won’t begin to pay the 2010 budget of the $4 trillion. Even if the government were to confiscate (aka steal) every penny made by those who earn $250,000 and above, it would only meet one-third of the goal. To pay for that whole $4 trillion budget, the government would have to pilfer “every taxable ‘dime’ of everyone earning more than $75,000.” That would just barely meet the goal, but those are 2006 numbers when the economy was good. In 2010, we’d need to go even lower. A tax cut for 95 percent? Not hardly. The government will give money with one hand and take it back and loads more with the other –- lying to us the whole time. ABC’s George Stephanopoulos summed it up well during his March 1 “This Week” show when, with a slip of the tongue, he referred to the omnibus spending bill as “omni-nous spending” –- an appropriate cross between omnibus and ominous spending. No kidding. It takes accidental phrasing to get honesty from the mainstream press – especially someone like Stephanopoulos who burns his cell phone minutes strategizing with his long-time Democratic buddies like James Carville, Paul Begala and Obama Chief of Staff Rahm Emanuel. The rest of the time, we get precious little information from the press about how we’ll pay through the nose and every other orifice. Instead, it’s just reheated talking points about 95 percent of us getting tax cuts. To quote Sam, “Wow, that wasn’t even remotely true.” Dan Gainor is The Boone Pickens Fellow and Vice President of the Media Research Center’s Business & Media Institute. His column appears each week on The Fox Forum and he can be seen each Thursday from 9-10:30 on Foxnews.com’s “Strategy Room.” ------------------------------------------------ This artical is so funny yet sooooooooo true!

content: It would be nice if just the top 2% of the population could pay for all of the spending that is going on, but it can't and besides, it isn't fair either. It is redistribution of wealth, right from the tool bag of SOCIALISM. Right this minute and for the rest of this generation and at least two generations or more out, the bill for the current spending will continue to be paid for. We have put our future generations into financial slavery. As we write our comments and send our letters and make our phone calls, taxes are being raised on every aspect of our lives that will require EVERY AMERICAN TAXPAYER to pay higher taxes; including the "non-tax paying" people. Under Bush and the tax cuts he enacted, the economy grew and our country was able to slug through 9/11 and several major disasters and fight conflicts in two separate areas, as well as send money to other countries to help them with their problems. Our economy was stable. In 2006, the Democrats got control of Congress and for some reason, Bush caught the spending disease and the economy started to waver. We, the people, were told that all was well and that a little belt tightening was all we needed. What really happened was, we were blatantly lied to and not by Bush. We were hoodwinked by the Democrats. Democrats such as Barack Obama, Barney Frank, Chris Dodd, Chuck Schumer, Maxine Waters and numerous others. They lied to us about the sub-prime lending institutions, Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac; they told America that there was no problem and that these areas were solvent. They were also receiving or had received campaign money from these institutions. We learned a harsh lesson; when Democrats lie enmasse, America suffers. To see how much of a lie this was, peruse an article at American Thinker. Go to their website, go to archives and find an article dated March 26th on how our economy became so screwed up. It's a long article, but well worth the reading. It outlines all of the lies and deception foisted on the American people by the radical left in Congress. Our economy started it's downward spiral in earnest when many people defaulted on their home loans, after their adjustable rate mortgages started going up. They were allowed to get into more home than they could possibly afford in the best of times and it was allowed, because our government made it happen. Because of the rewriting of prudent financial rules for homeownership, people were able to get very low interest, adjustable rate mortgages. They were also allowed to purchase homes that were way out of their price range; all because Democrats in Congress rewrote the rules and then lied about the ensuing problems that were beginning to show up. Bush started borrowing and spending to cover America's bills, while hoping that future tax cuts would spur additional economic growth. But, our economy was blindsided by the fiduciary failure of Congress to address the growing sub-prime lending crisis and the responsiblity for that rests squarely on the Democrats shoulders. Now, we have a party-hack-of-a-President spending huge amounts of money and threatening tax increases that is driving our economy further into the toilet. Tax increases at this juncture in our economic crisis is irresponsible and dangerous for America. There are many new taxes on the horizon for energy production, equipment and material production, and the transportation and distribution of all of these. There are also going to be taxes on the services we need and use everyday; taxes that will hit EVERYONE in the wallet. We sure got change we can believe in and we are going to have to "BELIEVE" it for four long years. No country, state or municipality ever taxed itself into prosperity; just into decline. What does our future hold?

COMMENT: This type of misdirected "partisan blame" is precisely the reason why we find ourselves saddled with such a economic catastrophe, and why the general frustration with government inaction and inefficiency continues. This perpetuates the needless "finger-pointing" and the "blame game." If one feels so smugly self-righteous politically, then we'll certainly continue an increasing level of public dissatisfaction and failing confidence in our government at all levels to be a boon to our way of life rather than intrusive and burdensome. Given the huge, record deficits eagerly accepted during the last administration, without increased tax revenues, there is no opportunity to move out of this economic abyss otherwise. No one is happy about the prospect of increased taxation; it's generally counterproductive and exponentially hurts those in the middle class the most. But tax cuts for the wealthy do not work, especially now, and the "trickle down" theory of prosperity has been credited and certainly has no credibility in this type of economic environment. So many are so critical about this administration in its less than 60 days of performance. It's this very type of parochial divisiveness that helped create this mess, and that will exacerbate its intensity.

We have put our future generations into financial slavery. As we write our comments and send our letters and make our phone calls, taxes are being raised on every aspect of our lives that will require EVERY AMERICAN TAXPAYER to pay higher taxes; including the "non-tax paying" people. Under Bush and the tax cuts he enacted, the economy grew and our country was able to slug through 9/11 and several major disasters and fight conflicts in two separate areas, as well as send money to other countries to help them with their problems. Our economy was stable. In 2006, the Democrats got control of Congress and for some reason, Bush caught the spending disease and the economy started to waver. We, the people, were told that all was well and that a little belt tightening was all we needed. What really happened was, we were blatantly lied to and not by Bush. We were hoodwinked by the Democrats. Democrats such as Barack Obama, Barney Frank, Chris Dodd, Chuck Schumer, Maxine Waters and numerous others. They lied to us about the sub-prime lending institutions, Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac; they told America that there was no problem and that these areas were solvent. They were also receiving or had received campaign money from these institutions. We learned a harsh lesson; when Democrats lie enmasse, America suffers. To see how much of a lie this was, peruse an article at American Thinker. Go to their website, go to archives and find an article dated March 26th on how our economy became so screwed up. It's a long article, but well worth the reading. It outlines all of the lies and deception foisted on the American people by the radical left in Congress. Our economy started it's downward spiral in earnest when many people defaulted on their home loans, after their adjustable rate mortgages started going up. They were allowed to get into more home than they could possibly afford in the best of times and it was allowed, because our government made it happen. Because of the rewriting of prudent financial rules for homeownership, people were able to get very low interest, adjustable rate mortgages. They were also allowed to purchase homes that were way out of their price range; all because Democrats in Congress rewrote the rules and then lied about the ensuing problems that were beginning to show up. Bush started borrowing and spending to cover America's bills, while hoping that future tax cuts would spur additional economic growth. But, our economy was blindsided by the fiduciary failure of Congress to address the growing sub-prime lending crisis and the responsiblity for that rests squarely on the Democrats shoulders. Now, we have a party-hack-of-a-President spending huge amounts of money and threatening tax increases that is driving our economy further into the toilet. Tax increases at this juncture in our economic crisis is irresponsible and dangerous for America. There are many new taxes on the horizon for energy production, equipment and material production, and the transportation and distribution of all of these. There are also going to be taxes on the services we need and use everyday; taxes that will hit EVERYONE in the wallet. We sure got change we can believe in and we are going to have to "BELIEVE" it for four long years. No country, state or municipality ever taxed itself into prosperity; just into decline. What does our future hold? COMMENT: This type of misdirected "partisan blame" is precisely the reason why we find ourselves saddled with such a economic catastrophe, and why the general frustration with government inaction and inefficiency continues. This perpetuates the needless "finger-pointing" and the "blame game." If one feels so smugly self-righteous politically, then we'll certainly continue an increasing level of public dissatisfaction and failing confidence in our government at all levels to be a boon to our way of life rather than intrusive and burdensome. Given the huge, record deficits eagerly accepted during the last administration, without increased tax revenues, there is no opportunity to move out of this economic abyss otherwise. No one is happy about the prospect of increased taxation; it's generally counterproductive and exponentially hurts those in the middle class the most. But tax cuts for the wealthy do not work, especially now, and the "trickle down" theory of prosperity has been credited and certainly has no credibility in this type of economic environment. So many are so critical about this administration in its less than 60 days of performance. It's this very type of parochial divisiveness that helped create this mess, and that will exacerbate its intensity. Maybe there is a reason so many people are being critical: under performance. The public ( I assure nopt me) was sold a bill of goods. And the current admin has not delievered, not even close. I think it is a GOOD thing here.. the left and right ARE coming together, the general public IS coming together...and maybe just maybe we will start demaning that our leaders do mor ethen just give us lip service. Maybe we can demand they actually lead. Cause from where I'm sitting we've not seen much real leadership sinced Reagan. And as for your statement that "trickledown" has been discredited, you simply could not be more wrong.

content: What else are the Dems doing? DNC rolls out 'Party of No' clock Posted: 12:47 PM ET 3/13/09 From CNN Associate Producer Martina Stewart WASHINGTON (CNN) – Democrats are not letting up in what has been a constant stream criticism in recent weeks of Republicans as obstructionist at a time of national economic crisis. In the nearly eight weeks since Obama’s inauguration, as the new administration and congressional Democrats have pushed through a $787 billion stimulus package and a $410 spending bill to fund the federal government’s operations, Republican congressional leaders have stressed fiscal restraint and accused Democrats of spending money the government does not have and should not be borrowing. DNC’s first TV ad targets Southern governor Posted: 11:54 AM ET 3/13/09 From CNN Political Editor Mark Preston WASHINGTON (CNN) – National Democrats will target South Carolina Gov. Mark Sanford in a new television ad next week that criticizes him for deciding not to accept all of the stimulus money set aside for his state, CNN has learned. Sanford, a Republican who is considered a potential presidential candidate in 2012, has maintained that spending the funds would only make the state’s financial situation worse in the long term. Instead, the governor told state legislators earlier this week that he wants to use a quarter of his state’s stimulus money to pay down its debt. Sanford’s request applies only to the $700 million in stimulus funds that he has discretion over, while the remaining $2.1 billion set aside for the state will be spent according to federal guidelines.

content: By Dan Gainor Vice President Business & Media Institute +++http://foxforum.blogs.foxnews.com/2009/03/04/gainor_obama_media/ In the 2004 movie “Garden State,” Natalie Portman plays Sam, a character who just can’t stop lying. “I don’t even know why I do it. It’s like… it’s like a tick, I mean sometimes I hear myself say something and then I think, wow, that wasn’t even remotely true,” she explains to lucky soon-to-be-boyfriend Zach Braff. Five years later, Sam would be working for Obama. Why? Because she lies and since she’s cute and charismatic, no one cares. What a perfect spokeswoman for the Obama administration. They lie with reckless abandon. But Obama flashes his trademark smile and no one notices –- especially the media. You won’t hear about the lying on ABC, CBS or NBC. Or read it in The Washington Post or New York Times either. Last year, the news media threw considerable influence behind President Pinocchio. Now journalism is in such financial distress, they’d be hard-pressed to fact check his cereal box. Besides it’s a sin of Washington etiquette to call a deliberate political misstatements “lies.” Only the uncouth call them actual lies. We are one month in to a marathon game of liar’s poker and the American public is playing the losing hand. It’s not as if the Obama folks are stupid. They aren’t. They aren’t even compulsive or pathological. They are simply of a breed apart from ordinary humans — they’re politicians. And it’s funny because that was the one thing they claimed they weren’t. The one big “change” from previous Washington creatures. But it’s no change at all. They lie about Iraq. They lie about guns. They lie about the economy. They lie about the size of government. Then they lie about lying. Welcome to the Pinocchio administration : Obama is the only one pulling strings on the media. The rest of us in the audience watch fascinated. You won’t hear about the lying on ABC, CBS or NBC. Or read it in The Washington Post or New York Times either. Last year, the news media threw considerable influence behind President Pinocchio. Now journalism is in such financial distress, they’d be hard-pressed to fact check his cereal box. Besides it’s a sin of Washington etiquette to call a deliberate political misstatements “lies.” Only the uncouth call them actual lies. Remember the Barack Obama who proposed pulling our troops out of Iraq by the end of 2008? “The days of our open-ended commitment must come to a close,” he told the Senate, according to a Jan. 31, 2007, Washington Post article. Now, according to the Associated Press, the open-ended commitment has been replaced with “as many as 50,000 troops to remain behind to train Iraqi forces and protect U.S. interests.” Even anti-war lefties think he lied. They are right –- for once. Remember that guy Obama who supported gun rights? He’s just a faint memory. A year ago, in an interview with Politico, Obama was reminded that supported gun ownership: “You said recently, ‘I have no intention of taking away folks’ guns.’ But you support the D.C. handgun ban, and you’ve said that it’s constitutional. How do you reconcile those two positions?” Even then he hemmed and hawed, concluding: “We can have a reasonable, thoughtful gun control measure that I think respects the Second Amendment and people’s traditions.” “Reasonable, thoughtful” are words unknown to Attorney General Eric Holder. Holder already has tried to link the Mexican narco-wars to U.S. gun sales and go after supposed “assault weapons.” Obama’s record on government and the economy is actually worse. He and his surrogates keep maintaining that his budget won’t hurt the pockets of 95 percent of Americans who will get a tax cut. They lie. The lead editorial in the Feb. 27 Wall Street Journal showed by just how much. Using 2006 tax records, The Wall Street Journal showed how a tax hike won’t begin to pay the 2010 budget of the $4 trillion. Even if the government were to confiscate (aka steal) every penny made by those who earn $250,000 and above, it would only meet one-third of the goal. To pay for that whole $4 trillion budget, the government would have to pilfer “every taxable ‘dime’ of everyone earning more than $75,000.” That would just barely meet the goal, but those are 2006 numbers when the economy was good. In 2010, we’d need to go even lower. A tax cut for 95 percent? Not hardly. The government will give money with one hand and take it back and loads more with the other –- lying to us the whole time. ABC’s George Stephanopoulos summed it up well during his March 1 “This Week” show when, with a slip of the tongue, he referred to the omnibus spending bill as “omni-nous spending” –- an appropriate cross between omnibus and ominous spending. No kidding. It takes accidental phrasing to get honesty from the mainstream press – especially someone like Stephanopoulos who burns his cell phone minutes strategizing with his long-time Democratic buddies like James Carville, Paul Begala and Obama Chief of Staff Rahm Emanuel. The rest of the time, we get precious little information from the press about how we’ll pay through the nose and every other orifice. Instead, it’s just reheated talking points about 95 percent of us getting tax cuts. To quote Sam, “Wow, that wasn’t even remotely true.” Dan Gainor is The Boone Pickens Fellow and Vice President of the Media Research Center’s Business & Media Institute. His column appears each week on The Fox Forum and he can be seen each Thursday from 9-10:30 on Foxnews.com’s “Strategy Room.” ------------------------------------------------ This artical is so funny yet sooooooooo true!

The lead editorial in the Feb. 27 Wall Street Journal showed by just how much. Using 2006 tax records, The Wall Street Journal showed how a tax hike won’t begin to pay the 2010 budget of the $4 trillion. Even if the government were to confiscate (aka steal) every penny made by those who earn $250,000 and above, it would only meet one-third of the goal. To pay for that whole $4 trillion budget, the government would have to pilfer “every taxable ‘dime’ of everyone earning more than $75,000.” That would just barely meet the goal, but those are 2006 numbers when the economy was good. In 2010, we’d need to go even lower. A tax cut for 95 percent? Not hardly. The government will give money with one hand and take it back and loads more with the other –- lying to us the whole time. ABC’s George Stephanopoulos summed it up well during his March 1 “This Week” show when, with a slip of the tongue, he referred to the omnibus spending bill as “omni-nous spending” –- an appropriate cross between omnibus and ominous spending. No kidding. It takes accidental phrasing to get honesty from the mainstream press – especially someone like Stephanopoulos who burns his cell phone minutes strategizing with his long-time Democratic buddies like James Carville, Paul Begala and Obama Chief of Staff Rahm Emanuel. The rest of the time, we get precious little information from the press about how we’ll pay through the nose and every other orifice. Instead, it’s just reheated talking points about 95 percent of us getting tax cuts. To quote Sam, “Wow, that wasn’t even remotely true.” Dan Gainor is The Boone Pickens Fellow and Vice President of the Media Research Center’s Business & Media Institute. His column appears each week on The Fox Forum and he can be seen each Thursday from 9-10:30 on Foxnews.com’s “Strategy Room.” ------------------------------------------------ This artical is so funny yet sooooooooo true!

content: It would be nice if just the top 2% of the population could pay for all of the spending that is going on, but it can't and besides, it isn't fair either. It is redistribution of wealth, right from the tool bag of SOCIALISM. Right this minute and for the rest of this generation and at least two generations or more out, the bill for the current spending will continue to be paid for. We have put our future generations into financial slavery. As we write our comments and send our letters and make our phone calls, taxes are being raised on every aspect of our lives that will require EVERY AMERICAN TAXPAYER to pay higher taxes; including the "non-tax paying" people. Under Bush and the tax cuts he enacted, the economy grew and our country was able to slug through 9/11 and several major disasters and fight conflicts in two separate areas, as well as send money to other countries to help them with their problems. Our economy was stable. In 2006, the Democrats got control of Congress and for some reason, Bush caught the spending disease and the economy started to waver. We, the people, were told that all was well and that a little belt tightening was all we needed. What really happened was, we were blatantly lied to and not by Bush. We were hoodwinked by the Democrats. Democrats such as Barack Obama, Barney Frank, Chris Dodd, Chuck Schumer, Maxine Waters and numerous others. They lied to us about the sub-prime lending institutions, Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac; they told America that there was no problem and that these areas were solvent. They were also receiving or had received campaign money from these institutions. We learned a harsh lesson; when Democrats lie enmasse, America suffers. To see how much of a lie this was, peruse an article at American Thinker. Go to their website, go to archives and find an article dated March 26th on how our economy became so screwed up. It's a long article, but well worth the reading. It outlines all of the lies and deception foisted on the American people by the radical left in Congress. Our economy started it's downward spiral in earnest when many people defaulted on their home loans, after their adjustable rate mortgages started going up. They were allowed to get into more home than they could possibly afford in the best of times and it was allowed, because our government made it happen. Because of the rewriting of prudent financial rules for homeownership, people were able to get very low interest, adjustable rate mortgages. They were also allowed to purchase homes that were way out of their price range; all because Democrats in Congress rewrote the rules and then lied about the ensuing problems that were beginning to show up. Bush started borrowing and spending to cover America's bills, while hoping that future tax cuts would spur additional economic growth. But, our economy was blindsided by the fiduciary failure of Congress to address the growing sub-prime lending crisis and the responsiblity for that rests squarely on the Democrats shoulders. Now, we have a party-hack-of-a-President spending huge amounts of money and threatening tax increases that is driving our economy further into the toilet. Tax increases at this juncture in our economic crisis is irresponsible and dangerous for America. There are many new taxes on the horizon for energy production, equipment and material production, and the transportation and distribution of all of these. There are also going to be taxes on the services we need and use everyday; taxes that will hit EVERYONE in the wallet. We sure got change we can believe in and we are going to have to "BELIEVE" it for four long years. No country, state or municipality ever taxed itself into prosperity; just into decline. What does our future hold?

No one is happy about the prospect of increased taxation; it's generally counterproductive and exponentially hurts those in the middle class the most. But tax cuts for the wealthy do not work, especially now, and the "trickle down" theory of prosperity has been credited and certainly has no credibility in this type of economic environment. So many are so critical about this administration in its less than 60 days of performance. It's this very type of parochial divisiveness that helped create this mess, and that will exacerbate its intensity.
reply: Maybe there is a reason so many people are being critical: under performance. The public ( I assure nopt me) was sold a bill of goods. And the current admin has not delievered, not even close. I think it is a GOOD thing here.. the left and right ARE coming together, the general public IS coming together...and maybe just maybe we will start demaning that our leaders do mor ethen just give us lip service. Maybe we can demand they actually lead. Cause from where I'm sitting we've not seen much real leadership sinced Reagan. And as for your statement that "trickledown" has been discredited, you simply could not be more wrong.

content: quote: Originally posted by Anchorman7275: It would be nice if just the top 2% of the population could pay for all of the spending that is going on, but it can't and besides, it isn't fair either. It is redistribution of wealth, right from the tool bag of SOCIALISM. Right this minute and for the rest of this generation and at least two generations or more out, the bill for the current spending will continue to be paid for. We have put our future generations into financial slavery. As we write our comments and send our letters and make our phone calls, taxes are being raised on every aspect of our lives that will require EVERY AMERICAN TAXPAYER to pay higher taxes; including the "non-tax paying" people. Under Bush and the tax cuts he enacted, the economy grew and our country was able to slug through 9/11 and several major disasters and fight conflicts in two separate areas, as well as send money to other countries to help them with their problems. Our economy was stable. In 2006, the Democrats got control of Congress and for some reason, Bush caught the spending disease and the economy started to waver. We, the people, were told that all was well and that a little belt tightening was all we needed. What really happened was, we were blatantly lied to and not by Bush. We were hoodwinked by the Democrats. Democrats such as Barack Obama, Barney Frank, Chris Dodd, Chuck Schumer, Maxine Waters and numerous others. They lied to us about the sub-prime lending institutions, Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac; they told America that there was no problem and that these areas were solvent. They were also receiving or had received campaign money from these institutions. We learned a harsh lesson; when Democrats lie enmasse, America suffers. To see how much of a lie this was, peruse an article at American Thinker. Go to their website, go to archives and find an article dated March 26th on how our economy became so screwed up. It's a long article, but well worth the reading. It outlines all of the lies and deception foisted on the American people by the radical left in Congress. Our economy started it's downward spiral in earnest when many people defaulted on their home loans, after their adjustable rate mortgages started going up. They were allowed to get into more home than they could possibly afford in the best of times and it was allowed, because our government made it happen. Because of the rewriting of prudent financial rules for homeownership, people were able to get very low interest, adjustable rate mortgages. They were also allowed to purchase homes that were way out of their price range; all because Democrats in Congress rewrote the rules and then lied about the ensuing problems that were beginning to show up. Bush started borrowing and spending to cover America's bills, while hoping that future tax cuts would spur additional economic growth. But, our economy was blindsided by the fiduciary failure of Congress to address the growing sub-prime lending crisis and the responsiblity for that rests squarely on the Democrats shoulders. Now, we have a party-hack-of-a-President spending huge amounts of money and threatening tax increases that is driving our economy further into the toilet. Tax increases at this juncture in our economic crisis is irresponsible and dangerous for America. There are many new taxes on the horizon for energy production, equipment and material production, and the transportation and distribution of all of these. There are also going to be taxes on the services we need and use everyday; taxes that will hit EVERYONE in the wallet. We sure got change we can believe in and we are going to have to "BELIEVE" it for four long years. No country, state or municipality ever taxed itself into prosperity; just into decline. People losing homes, jobs, and savings and yet the restraunts are full,roads congested and travel agents booming. Disney world and ammusment parks toy stores all doing good. God bless America. Well people Wars throw a monkey wrench into that fairy land sceniero and are costly. Where does the the money come from? So what services or luxuries do you want to give up? Cant have it both ways.

content: What else are the Dems doing? DNC rolls out 'Party of No' clock Posted: 12:47 PM ET 3/13/09 From CNN Associate Producer Martina Stewart WASHINGTON (CNN) – Democrats are not letting up in what has been a constant stream criticism in recent weeks of Republicans as obstructionist at a time of national economic crisis. In the nearly eight weeks since Obama’s inauguration, as the new administration and congressional Democrats have pushed through a $787 billion stimulus package and a $410 spending bill to fund the federal government’s operations, Republican congressional leaders have stressed fiscal restraint and accused Democrats of spending money the government does not have and should not be borrowing. DNC’s first TV ad targets Southern governor Posted: 11:54 AM ET 3/13/09 From CNN Political Editor Mark Preston WASHINGTON (CNN) – National Democrats will target South Carolina Gov. Mark Sanford in a new television ad next week that criticizes him for deciding not to accept all of the stimulus money set aside for his state, CNN has learned. Sanford, a Republican who is considered a potential presidential candidate in 2012, has maintained that spending the funds would only make the state’s financial situation worse in the long term. Instead, the governor told state legislators earlier this week that he wants to use a quarter of his state’s stimulus money to pay down its debt. Sanford’s request applies only to the $700 million in stimulus funds that he has discretion over, while the remaining $2.1 billion set aside for the state will be spent according to federal guidelines.

content: By Dan Gainor Vice President Business & Media Institute +++http://foxforum.blogs.foxnews.com/2009/03/04/gainor_obama_media/ In the 2004 movie “Garden State,” Natalie Portman plays Sam, a character who just can’t stop lying. “I don’t even know why I do it. It’s like… it’s like a tick, I mean sometimes I hear myself say something and then I think, wow, that wasn’t even remotely true,” she explains to lucky soon-to-be-boyfriend Zach Braff. Five years later, Sam would be working for Obama. Why? Because she lies and since she’s cute and charismatic, no one cares. What a perfect spokeswoman for the Obama administration. They lie with reckless abandon. But Obama flashes his trademark smile and no one notices –- especially the media. You won’t hear about the lying on ABC, CBS or NBC. Or read it in The Washington Post or New York Times either. Last year, the news media threw considerable influence behind President Pinocchio. Now journalism is in such financial distress, they’d be hard-pressed to fact check his cereal box. Besides it’s a sin of Washington etiquette to call a deliberate political misstatements “lies.” Only the uncouth call them actual lies. We are one month in to a marathon game of liar’s poker and the American public is playing the losing hand. It’s not as if the Obama folks are stupid. They aren’t. They aren’t even compulsive or pathological. They are simply of a breed apart from ordinary humans — they’re politicians. And it’s funny because that was the one thing they claimed they weren’t. The one big “change” from previous Washington creatures. But it’s no change at all. They lie about Iraq. They lie about guns. They lie about the economy. They lie about the size of government. Then they lie about lying. Welcome to the Pinocchio administration : Obama is the only one pulling strings on the media. The rest of us in the audience watch fascinated. You won’t hear about the lying on ABC, CBS or NBC. Or read it in The Washington Post or New York Times either. Last year, the news media threw considerable influence behind President Pinocchio. Now journalism is in such financial distress, they’d be hard-pressed to fact check his cereal box. Besides it’s a sin of Washington etiquette to call a deliberate political misstatements “lies.” Only the uncouth call them actual lies. Remember the Barack Obama who proposed pulling our troops out of Iraq by the end of 2008? “The days of our open-ended commitment must come to a close,” he told the Senate, according to a Jan. 31, 2007, Washington Post article. Now, according to the Associated Press, the open-ended commitment has been replaced with “as many as 50,000 troops to remain behind to train Iraqi forces and protect U.S. interests.” Even anti-war lefties think he lied. They are right –- for once. Remember that guy Obama who supported gun rights? He’s just a faint memory. A year ago, in an interview with Politico, Obama was reminded that supported gun ownership: “You said recently, ‘I have no intention of taking away folks’ guns.’ But you support the D.C. handgun ban, and you’ve said that it’s constitutional. How do you reconcile those two positions?” Even then he hemmed and hawed, concluding: “We can have a reasonable, thoughtful gun control measure that I think respects the Second Amendment and people’s traditions.” “Reasonable, thoughtful” are words unknown to Attorney General Eric Holder. Holder already has tried to link the Mexican narco-wars to U.S. gun sales and go after supposed “assault weapons.” Obama’s record on government and the economy is actually worse. He and his surrogates keep maintaining that his budget won’t hurt the pockets of 95 percent of Americans who will get a tax cut. They lie. The lead editorial in the Feb. 27 Wall Street Journal showed by just how much. Using 2006 tax records, The Wall Street Journal showed how a tax hike won’t begin to pay the 2010 budget of the $4 trillion. Even if the government were to confiscate (aka steal) every penny made by those who earn $250,000 and above, it would only meet one-third of the goal. To pay for that whole $4 trillion budget, the government would have to pilfer “every taxable ‘dime’ of everyone earning more than $75,000.” That would just barely meet the goal, but those are 2006 numbers when the economy was good. In 2010, we’d need to go even lower. A tax cut for 95 percent? Not hardly. The government will give money with one hand and take it back and loads more with the other –- lying to us the whole time. ABC’s George Stephanopoulos summed it up well during his March 1 “This Week” show when, with a slip of the tongue, he referred to the omnibus spending bill as “omni-nous spending” –- an appropriate cross between omnibus and ominous spending. No kidding. It takes accidental phrasing to get honesty from the mainstream press – especially someone like Stephanopoulos who burns his cell phone minutes strategizing with his long-time Democratic buddies like James Carville, Paul Begala and Obama Chief of Staff Rahm Emanuel. The rest of the time, we get precious little information from the press about how we’ll pay through the nose and every other orifice. Instead, it’s just reheated talking points about 95 percent of us getting tax cuts. To quote Sam, “Wow, that wasn’t even remotely true.” Dan Gainor is The Boone Pickens Fellow and Vice President of the Media Research Center’s Business & Media Institute. His column appears each week on The Fox Forum and he can be seen each Thursday from 9-10:30 on Foxnews.com’s “Strategy Room.” ------------------------------------------------ This artical is so funny yet sooooooooo true!

reply: It would be nice if just the top 2% of the population could pay for all of the spending that is going on, but it can't and besides, it isn't fair either. It is redistribution of wealth, right from the tool bag of SOCIALISM. Right this minute and for the rest of this generation and at least two generations or more out, the bill for the current spending will continue to be paid for. We have put our future generations into financial slavery. As we write our comments and send our letters and make our phone calls, taxes are being raised on every aspect of our lives that will require EVERY AMERICAN TAXPAYER to pay higher taxes; including the "non-tax paying" people. Under Bush and the tax cuts he enacted, the economy grew and our country was able to slug through 9/11 and several major disasters and fight conflicts in two separate areas, as well as send money to other countries to help them with their problems. Our economy was stable. In 2006, the Democrats got control of Congress and for some reason, Bush caught the spending disease and the economy started to waver. We, the people, were told that all was well and that a little belt tightening was all we needed. What really happened was, we were blatantly lied to and not by Bush. We were hoodwinked by the Democrats. Democrats such as Barack Obama, Barney Frank, Chris Dodd, Chuck Schumer, Maxine Waters and numerous others. They lied to us about the sub-prime lending institutions, Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac; they told America that there was no problem and that these areas were solvent. They were also receiving or had received campaign money from these institutions. We learned a harsh lesson; when Democrats lie enmasse, America suffers. To see how much of a lie this was, peruse an article at American Thinker. Go to their website, go to archives and find an article dated March 26th on how our economy became so screwed up. It's a long article, but well worth the reading. It outlines all of the lies and deception foisted on the American people by the radical left in Congress. Our economy started it's downward spiral in earnest when many people defaulted on their home loans, after their adjustable rate mortgages started going up. They were allowed to get into more home than they could possibly afford in the best of times and it was allowed, because our government made it happen. Because of the rewriting of prudent financial rules for homeownership, people were able to get very low interest, adjustable rate mortgages. They were also allowed to purchase homes that were way out of their price range; all because Democrats in Congress rewrote the rules and then lied about the ensuing problems that were beginning to show up. Bush started borrowing and spending to cover America's bills, while hoping that future tax cuts would spur additional economic growth. But, our economy was blindsided by the fiduciary failure of Congress to address the growing sub-prime lending crisis and the responsiblity for that rests squarely on the Democrats shoulders. Now, we have a party-hack-of-a-President spending huge amounts of money and threatening tax increases that is driving our economy further into the toilet. Tax increases at this juncture in our economic crisis is irresponsible and dangerous for America. There are many new taxes on the horizon for energy production, equipment and material production, and the transportation and distribution of all of these. There are also going to be taxes on the services we need and use everyday; taxes that will hit EVERYONE in the wallet. We sure got change we can believe in and we are going to have to "BELIEVE" it for four long years. No country, state or municipality ever taxed itself into prosperity; just into decline. What does our future hold?

COMMENT: This type of misdirected "partisan blame" is precisely the reason why we find ourselves saddled with such a economic catastrophe, and why the general frustration with government inaction and inefficiency continues. This perpetuates the needless "finger-pointing" and the "blame game." If one feels so smugly self-righteous politically, then we'll certainly continue an increasing level of public dissatisfaction and failing confidence in our government at all levels to be a boon to our way of life rather than intrusive and burdensome. Given the huge, record deficits eagerly accepted during the last administration, without increased tax revenues, there is no opportunity to move out of this economic abyss otherwise. No one is happy about the prospect of increased taxation; it's generally counterproductive and exponentially hurts those in the middle class the most. But tax cuts for the wealthy do not work, especially now, and the "trickle down" theory of prosperity has been credited and certainly has no credibility in this type of economic environment. So many are so critical about this administration in its less than 60 days of performance. It's this very type of parochial divisiveness that helped create this mess, and that will exacerbate its intensity.

content: What else are the Dems doing? DNC rolls out 'Party of No' clock Posted: 12:47 PM ET 3/13/09 From CNN Associate Producer Martina Stewart WASHINGTON (CNN) – Democrats are not letting up in what has been a constant stream criticism in recent weeks of Republicans as obstructionist at a time of national economic crisis. In the nearly eight weeks since Obama’s inauguration, as the new administration and congressional Democrats have pushed through a $787 billion stimulus package and a $410 spending bill to fund the federal government’s operations, Republican congressional leaders have stressed fiscal restraint and accused Democrats of spending money the government does not have and should not be borrowing. DNC’s first TV ad targets Southern governor Posted: 11:54 AM ET 3/13/09 From CNN Political Editor Mark Preston WASHINGTON (CNN) – National Democrats will target South Carolina Gov. Mark Sanford in a new television ad next week that criticizes him for deciding not to accept all of the stimulus money set aside for his state, CNN has learned. Sanford, a Republican who is considered a potential presidential candidate in 2012, has maintained that spending the funds would only make the state’s financial situation worse in the long term. Instead, the governor told state legislators earlier this week that he wants to use a quarter of his state’s stimulus money to pay down its debt. Sanford’s request applies only to the $700 million in stimulus funds that he has discretion over, while the remaining $2.1 billion set aside for the state will be spent according to federal guidelines.
